title: HTML Links
gp1: Links are found in nearly all web pages. Links allow users to click their way from page to page.
gp2: You can click on a link and jump to another document.
gp3: When you move the mouse over a link, the mouse arrow will turn into a little hand.
gp4: Clicking on the link text, will send the reader to the specified URL address.
gp5: By default, the linked page will be displayed in the current browser window. To change this, you must specify another target for the link.
wp1: Both examples above are using an absolute URL (a full web address) in the href attribute.
